quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Echo[/h1]

PHP has a built-in "[b]echo[/b]" function, which is used to output text. 
In actuality, it's not a function; it's a[b] language construct[/b]. As such, it does not require parentheses.

Let's output a text. [code format="php" codeId="457"]<?php
  [b]echo[/b] "I love PHP!";
?>[/code] 
[note]The text should be in single or double [b]quotation marks[/b].[/note]

quizzes.question: Which character has to be at the end of each statement?

Fill in the blanks to output "SoloLearn" as a h1 heading:
[!raw!]
<?php
  echo "{0}SoloLearn{1}";
?>
quizzes.textContent: [h1]Echo[/h1] HTML markup can be added to the text in the [b]echo [/b]statement.[code format="php" codeId="459"]This is a bold text."; ?>[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2782" width="100%"]
